website_summaries.verdict: A fun and challenging trivia game great for adults.
pros: Praised for its variety of questions, challenging trivia, and fun play, this game includes history and other trivia that some users felt was best geared towards adults, though its suitable for a variety of ages
cons: A few felt the questions were a bit too challenging or that the rules were a bit difficult to understand

customer_reviews.title: ... 5 star review by saying that two of us like this game and two hate it but I really ...
customer_reviews.text: I suppose I should qualify my 5 star review by saying that two of us like this game and two hate it but I really like it A LOT. It is kind of like Trivial Pursuit, but there are different types of questions, which use different types of knowledge/intelligence to figure out--it's not just about knowing facts (though that's the biggest part of it). I cannot figure out why the others don't like it and they haven't been able to articulate what they find objectionable about this game. I think it is really fun.
customer_reviews.author: Andi

customer_reviews.title: Best trivia game!
customer_reviews.text: Our family loves trivia and this is by far our favorite trivia game! We have an engineer, a chemistry professor, a paleontologist and an art history grad student and all four of us enjoy playing. The questions range in difficulty and provide a challenge without being frustrating and obscure. I can't count how many game nights we've had with Wit's End and we still haven't run into the same questions. We enjoy it way more than Trivial Pursuit and other such games. We absolutely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: New twist on the traditional trivia game
customer_reviews.text: We love this game! It offers a nice twist to the traditional Trivia Pursuit game. Even if you don't know the answers you still have a chance of guessing it. The questions don't make you feel like a fool for not knowing the answers. Also, it doesn't take all day to play. I gave this one as a gift but I might get one for my house.
customer_reviews.author: Mommaeagle

customer_reviews.title: this is not a fun nor an entertaining game
customer_reviews.text: i read the reviews that this was a fun game with the questions and also the difficulty in ascending levels. This may have been a fluke but through 4 players turns one player was able to ascend to the top. This game was not as advertised and it gets very little use at game nights. If you like trivia type games I would go with "This, That and Everything." or "Smart-ass." both games are much more entertaining.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Bowers

customer_reviews.title: My family loves this game
customer_reviews.text: We are a game-playing family, but have no patience for a game that requires learning tons of rules. In fact, this game comes with a game board but we don't use it - we just ask the questions sitting in our recliners and eating popcorn. Hey - don't judge. The questions are challenging but not impossible (we're no geniuses...), and they require different types of intelligence, so a person who is good at one type of thing but not another has a chance to get some right. There are a huge number of questions, sort of like Trivial Pursuit, so I don't see us running out of cards any time soon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Family fun, teens and up
customer_reviews.text: Gifted this game to my teenage son who is very smart and enjoys “useless knowledge” type trivia. The game wasn’t difficult to learn to play and can be played with 2 or more players (as individuals or as teams). It was a fun game but truly is for teens and up as the trivia is too difficult for anymore under the suggested age of 16. If you know your history, your world events and your geography, you will love this game. I am terrible at the game and none of those are strong points for me but I still had fun failing shamelessly over and over. 🤭
customer_reviews.author: StewCrew

customer_reviews.title: Fun New Take on Trivia
customer_reviews.text: We love this game. For years I was trying to find updated versions of Trivial Pursuit, but they didn't seem to exist (now they do though). So I started looking for alternatives to Trivial Pursuit. I found Wits End and it is a neat new take on the Trivial Pursuit idea. Rather than simply answering trivia questions, Wits End poses the trivia questions to you in different ways (some are harder than others). Great game to play with the family or friends.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Mcmorris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice in this board game
customer_reviews.text: We wanted a trivial pursuit game that was fun and this version is such with interesting and generational questions from many subject areas. Sturdy board regardless of 4 folds. And it has good colors and attention to detail. As do with the play cards. Pawns are plastic but made very well they could pass for wood and are a neat retro design. Excellent value for the money and a good choice for a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Verbose.
customer_reviews.text: Gameplay itself was really easy. My big problem is the questions aren't really great when read out loud. At one point we just gave up and let the person answering the question just read the card. The questions are just too wordy to be read out loud.
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: A fun game with bonus learning :)
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh this game is a hoot! I love that this game can be played over and over and each time a different question can be asked. I will say the questions can be hard but I’d be lying if I said I didn’t learn a lot while playing this game!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Rose

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: The questions are no good. Too many random riddles you will never get. Too many "in what order would you put..." on things that would be impossible for most people to know. Plus the game play is long as you can get bumped back if you miss certain questions. We got rid of this game after playing it twice. Too many better games out there.
customer_reviews.author: You Don't Know

customer_reviews.title: I love it, but can see why many would hate it....
customer_reviews.text: I love this game. The questions are obscure and annoying, and our group of highly educated friends (in varying fields) has to work in groups to logic out the most probable answers. Oftentimes we laugh out loud at the ridiculous way questions are asked. I'm sure people will either love or hate this trivia game. There probably won't be a lot of in-between.
customer_reviews.author: Julianne

customer_reviews.title: Great game, but not very witty
customer_reviews.text: From the way it sounded, I thought this game would be more "witty" and less pure trivia, but it's much more actual trivia and it's really very difficult. It's super fun, if you're a history buff or just really good at random trivia, but if you're more focused on "wit," I just want you to know what you're getting into.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: That being said it’s not the best but it’s not the worst trivia game as a ...
customer_reviews.text: While the concept is phenomenal, their is room for improvement. Most of the questions are for 40, maybe 50 or over crowd. As an example Their is a lot of 1900’s-1980s popculture and very little 90s through modern day. That being said it’s not the best but it’s not the worst trivia game as a good amount of questions you can make logical assumptions to find the answers
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Good educational game, and still fun to play
customer_reviews.text: I like trivia games, and when they're edicational, it's even better. We homeschool and I bought this game for my now 14yo twins. The game is fun and challenging - even for me, yet still a game more than a lesson (good thing) Better than Brain Games (big yellow box) ever was!
customer_reviews.author: BruiserMommy

customer_reviews.title: Me and my husband had fun playing this
customer_reviews.text: Me and my husband had fun playing this. There are so many trivia cards that this game will be fun for a long time. We didn't know a lot of the questions but had fun with the ones we did know and also learning knew things.
customer_reviews.author: Gus

customer_reviews.title: Intellectually stimulating
customer_reviews.text: Calling all intellectuals! This game is fun & challenging. It can be played with one other person, or a group. There are a ton of categories to keep things interesting, and the average game play is about 2 hours. This game is best suited for high school age and up.
customer_reviews.author: KJulia

customer_reviews.title: we liked this game because it only requires two people and ...
customer_reviews.text: For the same reasons as mentioned elsewhere, we liked this game because it only requires two people and it was a challenging without being too discouraging. I like Cranium more tho because that one gives you a chance to use visual skills as well as verbal, thereby allowing everyone who plays an area of strength during play (e.g., I tend to be more spatially oriented and my husband tends to be a better historian). All that being said, my husband and I just played two rounds of the game and, considering how restless we can get during games, that says something positive about Wit's End ;)
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Great Trivia Game!
customer_reviews.text: So much fun! The questions are challenging and very current. Plus, the different categories make for a little bit of strategy. Our multigenerational family has a blast playing this. If you loved Trivial Pursuit, you will definitely love this!
customer_reviews.author: The Lovey Mom

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic game
customer_reviews.text: Best trivia game I’ve played. Good for teens and adults alike. The categories and questions make it unlike other trivia games.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Boring and frustrating
customer_reviews.text: Playing this game felt like taking a very boring US history exam. The questions were tedious (i.e putting 4 very obscure events in order) so each turn you ended up just randomly guessing. There were also riddles that made no sense and were impossible to guess. It was not fun at all. I love trivia, but this was terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Myers

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: We love this game. We got the junior version, too, and use those cards for the younger players and the adult cards for the older players. We ad-lib how we play so everyone has fun and this is a winner. One of the grands will read the cards for hours, trying to puzzle out the riddles.
customer_reviews.author: Trudyg

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: We were very disappointed by this game. We love games and this sounded good because it was challenging. We like the challenging part but found it to be annoying because some parts for super challenging and somewhere super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Not the pull-out play game....study
customer_reviews.text: This game wasn’t what I expected. I enjoy a challenge but the game was fining out how to play it. It’s too difficult so we really couldn’t get in the groove quickly. This is one of those games you learn and it takes a while to become competitive.
customer_reviews.author: Tamesha Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: I expected more from this game having read other reviews. It’s easy to follow and learn to play. Personally I found it rather dry and boring. I prefer games that spur creativity, competition, and/or make me laugh. This did none of that.
customer_reviews.author: Renata Calhoun

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: I just opened the box on Easter to play with my family and I was hugely disappointed to find that the only thing in the box was the directions, game cards and the board. There was no die and no playing pieces. I was at my sister's house and she had no dice so we had download an app on my nieces phone to use for the player movements and we had to use coins for the player pieces. It was not what I expected for a brand new game.
customer_reviews.author: Bart Verwilt

customer_reviews.title: If you're looking for a game with a good balance of worldwide trivia, this isn't it.
customer_reviews.text: As a number of people have commented, a very US-centric game, which is great if that's what your going for. Lots of statistical questions... dates, numbers, percentages, etc. that you either studied as a discipline and so know the subject matter or you guess. Many questions are hard, or obscure. Others are ridiculously simple.
customer_reviews.author: John Goulding

customer_reviews.title: Even with a complete game  -  an unnecessarily confusing board.
customer_reviews.text: Well, it is difficult. I was frustrated I received an incomplete game ( no instructions? or else it makes no sense. Returned because it was unplayable as received.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Richards

customer_reviews.title: Fun family game
customer_reviews.text: My family loves this game, ages 14 and up. It's more "user friendly" than Trivial Pursuit because a lot of the questions are multiple-choice or putting things in the right order, so even if you don't know the answer you least have a chance of getting it right.
customer_reviews.author: Staci Burke

customer_reviews.title: Trivia with a twist... fun!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome game! Different types of question formats make it interesting... love the brain teasers! I could think of a couple of ways to make it better, but we've been having so much fun with it, I can't really complain at all...
customer_reviews.author: K.

customer_reviews.title: History and Art buffs
customer_reviews.text: This game is meant for those that are history and art buffs, neither of which am I. 2 out of the 4 of us, really enjoyed this game, For me, I couldn't wait to put it back in the box. :)
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAholic

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: Our family has traditionally played Trivial Pursuit when we get together. I purchased this for some variety over the holidays and it was a total hit. We didn't even get out any other games; we all had so much fun with this one.
customer_reviews.author: kattwmn

customer_reviews.title: The game is fun but a little cumbersome and long
customer_reviews.text: The game is fun but a little cumbersome and long. Not for a quick casual time killer. Serious and competitive players will enjoy this game. Nice packaging and contents.
customer_reviews.author: Always On The Go

customer_reviews.title: Very fun and challenging game
customer_reviews.text: Very fun and challenging game. We play with teenagers (16 & 19) and we all enjoy it a lot. Some of the questions are quite difficult but overall it is a very exciting game to play and for the most part a full game can be played in about an hour, maybe 90 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to learn to play - hard questions
customer_reviews.text: This was a simple game to learn but I thought the questions were very hard. Having people keep rolling the dice when they get a question right can lead to other players getting bored waiting for their turn. Also, having some kind of time limit for answers would help it move along faster.
customer_reviews.author: OkieReader

customer_reviews.title: Difficult game
customer_reviews.text: Poor instruction. Played as a family of 4 adults. It was difficult. Not because we aren't smart, we are. We made up instructions that are much more fun.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth J. Hullinger

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love this game! Definitely not for everyone though, you need to be fairly intelligent to stand a chance at this game.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M couture II

customer_reviews.title: Great Game!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to learn family game ( 21 yo and 16 yo kids loved it). It’s tricky enough to keep your interest but didn't frustrate anyone.
customer_reviews.author: J. Carreiro

customer_reviews.title: Fun but one question is wrong
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun game but so far we have found one of the sports answers to be incorrect.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: What you thought you knew.
customer_reviews.text: Yes, another trivia board game, but no, not like the others. The questions are asked in a different way. So, you have to think about what you thought you knew.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Love this game!
customer_reviews.text: Interesting categories, a twist on regular trivia. I play this in a therapeutic setting with clients of varying abilities, and all of them enjoy it. My family loves it too!
customer_reviews.author: JocelynD

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I am a fan of intellectually challenging games and this one is great! Makes for a good way to get friends and family together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So much fun
customer_reviews.text: We absolutel Love this game. We are a board game family and this moved up to the #1 spot. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Elisa

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this game
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this game, the directions are easy to follow and the Trivia is hard but fun to do. I've played it with several friends and we absolutely love it. You really have to bring your A-Game when playing it, it's a challenge worth doing.
customer_reviews.author: CJNAROSE

customer_reviews.title: A new trivial pursuit
customer_reviews.text: I loved it! Like a new trivial pursuit game. Some of the questions are really hard but it's just hard on your areas of knowledge. My family and I played it Christmas night and had a ball.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin C.

customer_reviews.title: Tons of fun, and the variety lets everyone particiate
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for my board-game-loving mom, and it was an absolute hit! Wit's End has a great balance of questions that allows everyone to participate, and enough luck involved to keep any one person from dominating for too long. It's just as much fun with only a couple players as it is with a room full of people in teams. It's now right up there with Catchphrase as one of our go-to games for company.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Terwilliger

customer_reviews.title: My family and I love this game
customer_reviews.text: Great game! My family and I played this several times over the holidays and really enjoyed it. The questions are very current and it is a nice twist on typical trivia question games.
customer_reviews.author: Judson Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Fun trivia game
customer_reviews.text: Fun. Bought as a gift. It’s like any trivia game. I like the riddles especially
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Fun but needs more questions!
customer_reviews.text: My siblings and I played this game the minute we brought it home and it was challenging but very fun. Definitely going to become a staple of game night for my family! UPDATE: After playing this game three times (3 Player games) we ran out of cards! Boo! Please make an expansion pack! We love this game! :'(
customer_reviews.author: RSESQ

customer_reviews.title: Gifted
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for daughter and son in law. They said it was a good game.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Aumand

customer_reviews.title: challenging, humbling, enduring
customer_reviews.text: Trivial Pursuit on crack. That's all I have to say. Even the most shameless glory hound at the game table was humbled by some of the questions in this game. We've played quite a few times, and it continues to be a challenging, social, and conversation-inspiring time. Science buffs, literature geeks, pop culture mavens, sports fanatics, and history worms will all find a home here, and general-knowledge compilers will be hard-pressed to use all their powers to get through. Definitely not a game for the weak-minded, this game left more than a few players in the dirt. Play in teams.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun logic game meets trivia
customer_reviews.text: If you like trivial pursuit and logic puzzles this is the game for you. Lots of variety in questions. The riddles aren’t too hard where you can’t get them. A nice twist to standard trivia game and also fun for just two people.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Sandul

customer_reviews.title: Love, love love this game
customer_reviews.text: Love, love love this game. We often sit around the couch & go through a stack of card without the board. It's a clever way to assess your knowledge as well as looking at what you know in a different way. For young & old alike, especially if you have teens or college aged kids... it is a great tool to learn test taking tricks. I can't say enough about this game.
customer_reviews.author: Patti Molinar-Spero

customer_reviews.title: One of the best board games.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome game. Would highly recommend to those who enjoy trivia and riddles. This game is a compilation of several of my favorite things and I just can't get over how inexpensive it is. The game pieces and border seem to be of good quality and my friends and family very much enjoy it. Would highly recommend to knowledge lovers looking or a very fun game to play.
customer_reviews.author: Jonas Rodney

customer_reviews.title: Very fun game! Tests your knowledge
customer_reviews.text: Very fun game! Tests your knowledge, but with the variety of types of questions/riddles, etc you can get, it makes this a really fun game to play.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t like the questions included, overall poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Game pieces and board seem cheap. Question cards not interesting or clever. Poor alternative to Trivial Pursuit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than trivial pursuit
customer_reviews.text: We have a lot of fun with this. Good for young teens on up. Really enjoy the more creative thinking involved.
customer_reviews.author: JuliaColorado

customer_reviews.title: My family enjoys this game.
customer_reviews.text: My family enjoys this game. Questions are broad and offers a selections of categories that challenge everyone, but you don't have to be a Jeopardy contestant to provide a correct answer.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Fun game
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun game but buckle up because it can take a while to play and win. It is worth the time it takes to play.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua M.

customer_reviews.title: It's great! We play it all the time
customer_reviews.text: I hadn't heard of this game prior to ordering it. It's great! We play it all the time!
customer_reviews.author: Alice ThompsonTop Contributor: Harmonicas

customer_reviews.title: fun, educational
customer_reviews.text: fun, educational. very different that Trivial Pursuit - these questions are not trivial! Good to play once in a while - not an every night game. god amount of competition. The board itself is a tad flimsy, and once you burn thru all the cards - well, you'll need new ones. But good to have as an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni Tampa

customer_reviews.title: Good game
customer_reviews.text: Awesome game and its kid friendly. Wanted an alternative to Trivial Pursuit since we've played those so much. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: ciennakay

customer_reviews.title: Too Much Luck, but Family Friendly, Easy to Learn.
customer_reviews.text: Decent game, luck of dice role can impact the game a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Grzywacz

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: play this and you realize how much you do not know
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun game! Brought to Christmas with the family and ...
customer_reviews.text: Fun game! Brought to Christmas with the family and they were hooked - ended up buying three more so they could each have one of their own!
customer_reviews.author: nichme

customer_reviews.title: The questions are pretty good though
customer_reviews.text: Decent game. My only complaint is that the board game (including the instructions and pieces) seems to be manufactured on a low budget. Kinda cheap and basic. The questions are pretty good though.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Bass

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun.
customer_reviews.text: Fun game. You can answer some questions with logic. Love choices for possible answers.
customer_reviews.author: momdovan

customer_reviews.title: If you have that super smart brother, sister, mom or dad...
customer_reviews.text: This is the hardest trivia game by far that I have ever played. I bought it for my brother for Christmas last year--he easily swims through all of the other trivia games that I had bought him. With this one, he said he definitely was challenged. Some questions were down-right obscure and random. Others were just extremely challenging. This is not a game for those who do not take trivia and knowledge seriously--it will probably bore you, like it does my youngest sister and boyfriend. However, if like my brother and I you thrive on random facts, this is the perfect fit for you.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Family game night is fun again!
customer_reviews.text: We loved this game! The questions range from super easy to head scratcher. We played teams and singles and learned a few things along the way. It moves along quite quickly and one person even beat the whole game in one turn! Everyone wanted to play just one more game.
customer_reviews.author: Tisha C

customer_reviews.title: Good twist on trivia game
customer_reviews.text: Good twist on trivia game. Age for players on box correct. Younger players would have a hard time. Lots of types of questions, so even if you do not know the exact answer, you may be able to figure it out or just guess it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Biles

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Fun game! Great questions, we have played this game at least 20 times and never had a repeat question!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke B.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to learn and lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: A ton of fun! Played this with family groups on more than one occasion, ages ranging 8 to 58. Every time we play people end up laughing and cheering each other on.
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid A. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Made a Terrific Christmas gift - whole family enjoyed playing together.
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as a gift to my 40 year old kids and then played it with them over Christmas. They loved it! I got educated!
customer_reviews.author: Sally Sanford

customer_reviews.title: Yea! A board game that challenges you
customer_reviews.text: The questions make you think. Rigorous, but not frustrating. If you like to use your noggin and you pay attention to the world around you then you will like this game. I should add that I thoroughly enjoyed it even though I finished nearly last. :)
customer_reviews.author: EM Chikin

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it!
customer_reviews.text: This game is really awesome. I got it for my trivia-loving husband and really the whole family loves to play because it isn't like other trivia games. It's kinda like sorry and trivia put together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One of the funnest games I've played!
customer_reviews.text: Super fun!!! No, you probably won't know 1/2 the answers, and you have to love trivia, but I love the fact that you learn playing it!!! It even has riddles =). It's basically like a better Trivial Pursuit...way better.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Like Trivial Pursuit
customer_reviews.text: Like Trivial Pursuit. Easy game to learn rules-wise, but the trivia questions are quite challenging. We had a great time playing this with relatives- one enjoyed it so much he ordered his own on the spot!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Challenging and fun
customer_reviews.text: Excellent game if you think you are someone smart who knows a lot of trivia amd or can logic things out. Our family likes the challenge.
customer_reviews.author: kthalsbuystuff

customer_reviews.title: Fast Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Friends tend to feel dumb after a round - if playing with you-know-who, best to play teams to avoid hurt feelings!
customer_reviews.author: OneThingReal

customer_reviews.title: A fun game, purchased for our daughters after we played ...
customer_reviews.text: A fun game, purchased for our daughters after we played it at a family reunion. Everyone enjoyed it, ages 74 - 8!
customer_reviews.author: innergame

customer_reviews.title: Die not included
customer_reviews.text: Came without special die which is required to play the game
customer_reviews.author: Joseph DiFrancesco

customer_reviews.title: Better have friends with brains
customer_reviews.text: This game is HARD. It is fun but extremely challenging intellectually. I do recommend it but be prepared.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Dolan

customer_reviews.title: We had fun
customer_reviews.text: Great game but the questions were quite challenging. Be prepared to play for 3 hrs if you’re not used to trivia type games
customer_reviews.author: ZRTman

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great game and it will test your intelligence in all different categories.
customer_reviews.author: Sabs

customer_reviews.title: Great game to play with older kids (or really crazy smart younger ones)
customer_reviews.text: This game is a lot of fun. Our kids are 18 and 19 years old and this is a great game to play as a family on game night. It's intelligent, tests your knowledge, makes you think and you'll probably learn something every time you play.
customer_reviews.author: Burley and Shirley

customer_reviews.title: So fun!
customer_reviews.text: This game is awesome! So much fun. Riddles, trivia, general knowledge - it is great. Perfect for 2 or more!
customer_reviews.author: colojess

customer_reviews.title: Great for two players
customer_reviews.text: Great for two players. Nice balance of luck and skill. The riddles are really fun but vary in difficulty tremendously.
customer_reviews.author: \Custome

customer_reviews.title: Family fun!
customer_reviews.text: This was the game of the year. Brought all generations together in a fun and challenging way.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Sereda

customer_reviews.title: Great fun yet challenging questions that really require you to ...
customer_reviews.text: Great fun yet challenging questions that really require you to think. Especially great to bring the cards into the car with you on a road trip to help pass the time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Family fun, mind twisting game!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously such a fun and amazing game! It is a fun game that you can do with any family members. Would highly recomend it for a good time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This game is so fun!
customer_reviews.text: This game is a riot. We have played it about 10 times and I love love love it! Great replayability, and you could really play it with anyone over the age of 20 I think.
customer_reviews.author: K Grasher

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun game, but be ready to do some thinking the questions cover a lot of topics.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best gift for a family!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for a friend's family and we couldn't stop playing it! This game is so fun! It's nice to have the variety of trivia, riddles, and more. The trivia is more friendly for groups of mixed ages than many other games I've played.
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Good deal but can be challenging for children
customer_reviews.text: A board game for the family. Questions are pretty hard. May discourage young children from playing due to difficulty level.
customer_reviews.author: Chong

customer_reviews.title: Good for a holiday game night
customer_reviews.text: The board aspect of the game is lacking. If you like trivia it's a decent game with good questions and riddles.
customer_reviews.author: mackenzie moore

customer_reviews.title: Know your facts
customer_reviews.text: My smartie pants kids had to work for this win and I think that was great hopefully they learned something
customer_reviews.author: Gail l. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This game is a ton of fun! Plenty of questions to continue playing.
customer_reviews.author: Afton Esson

customer_reviews.title: What Trivial Pursuit wishes it was
customer_reviews.text: This game is so fun and mentally challenging but the questions are answered pretty easily by common sense...most of the time
customer_reviews.author: Jay Roberts

customer_reviews.title: How Fun!
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed playing this game. Challenging yet simple to play.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy K

customer_reviews.title: Seems family oriented.
customer_reviews.text: Exchange game family fun! 18 & older is age. Haven’t played to date.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Sherman

product_meta.title: Wit's End Board Game
feature_bullets: More than just trivia, Wit's End is a game of brain teasers and riddles in diverse categories.
In TEASERS, you solve mind riddles; In ODD-1-OUT, you find which one of the four options does not belong.
In SEQUENCE, put things in order (by year, weight, size etc); in WILD CARD, anything goes.
Includes 1200 questions about popular culture, geography, arts, history, science and more...
An Award Winner! Ages 16 to Adult.
